name: Seaside Jawari
description: This algorithm is based on the open source Jawari VCV Rack module by Seaside Modular. It simulates a tanpura, an Indian drone instrument with four strings typically played in sequence as a continuous loop. Each strum advances to and plays the next string. The second, third, and fourth strings are tuned in octaves (fourth string an octave below), while the first string is often tuned to the fifth of the scale. Microtuning support allows for authentic just intervals.
gui_description: The display shows the tuning of the four strings, with the last string played highlighted.

parameters.name: Bridge shape
parameters.description: Sets the blend between the raw string pluck and a comb filtered version.

parameters.name: Tuning (1st string)
parameters.description: Sets the tuning of the first string, in semitones above the fourth string.

parameters.name: Strum (parameter)
parameters.description: Causes a strum when changed from 0 to 1.

parameters.name: Damping
parameters.description: The damping factor for the string model.

parameters.name: Bounce count
parameters.description: The number of bridge bounces after the initial strum.

parameters.name: Start harmonic
parameters.description: The emphasized harmonic at the start of the bounces.

parameters.name: End harmonic
parameters.description: The emphasized harmonic at the end of the bounces.

input_ports.name: Strum (input)
input_ports.description: Trigger input for advancing to the next string.

input_ports.name: Bridge shape (CV)
input_ports.description: CV control over the bridge shape blend.

input_ports.name: Reset
input_ports.description: Trigger input for resetting the sequence.

input_ports.name: V/oct main
input_ports.description: Pitch control bus for tuning the whole instrument.

input_ports.name: V/oct 1st string
input_ports.description: Pitch control bus for tuning the first string.

output_ports.name: Output
output_ports.description: Audio output of the tanpura strings.
